intro: Cyphia rogersii subsp. winteri, commonly known as the Winter's cyphia, is a rare and striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, specifically Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late winter. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
